column4: does anyone know how to remove a mount option from a disk (set via the gui) in ubuntu 9.04?
I set a bad option, now the disk won't mount but I can't find where to unset the option
Option?... I don't think we even set mouse options via the GUI at all
Anyway, unless it's the root drive, you should edit /etc/fstab manually
err, s/mouse/mount/, sorry, idk what I was thinking about xD
Add it to fstab then, what's the big deal with that
the big deal is I got 25 of these devices and I need to configure some mount options which must preferably be set via the gui some I don't have to do it myself :)
I don't even know *how* to set mount options via the GUI
yet I need to do it via the gui, I know how to mount a drive manually or via fstab
but I have no set the option and it must be stored *somewhere*
I found it in .gconf/system/storage/volumes, dunno if that is dconf though, but I found it :)
Yeah. But don't touch that manually. Use gconf-editor.
Or else you might make GNOME unusable
